page.title: 10CHANGES IN WILLOUGHBY
page.content: Just before the Second World War there were about 17{farms}in Willoughby but soon after, most of them were demolished and new houses built in their place.There also used to be a butcher and a baker but now there is a pie shop and a general store.Where the pie shop is now, there used to be a chapel.This was one of three{chapels in the village at that time.The others were the Methodist which still stands on Main Street and the Baptist, which was at the corner of Widmerpool Lane and was knocked down in the 1970's when the three chapels joined together. The{school}was built in 1863 and in 1900 there were 90 childern in it compared with 36 in 1985.There was no water in school,so it was fetched from the headteacher's house.
